meanings.definition: A popular assembly or meeting of the people in early medieval England.
meanings.sent1: The folkmot gathered under the ancient oak tree to discuss village matters.
meanings.sent2: The annual folkmot was a chance for everyone in the town to come together and share their ideas.
meanings.sent3: At the folkmot, the villagers debated whether chickens or goats made better pets.
meanings.sent4: The folkmot was a buzzing hive of voices, each one eager to be heard.
meanings.sent5: The image of the folkmot, with its diverse attendees, stayed etched in his memory.

meanings.definition: A gathering or assembly of people, especially for discussing and making decisions on community matters.
meanings.sent1: The folkmot at the town hall was filled with lively discussions about the upcoming festival.
meanings.sent2: Neighbors gathered at the folkmot to vote on the new playground equipment.
meanings.sent3: The folkmot turned into a friendly competition of who could tell the best joke.
meanings.sent4: In the bustling folkmot, ideas collided like waves crashing on the shore.
meanings.sent5: The atmosphere at the folkmot was charged with excitement and anticipation.
